articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Emir of Kuwait
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Emir of Kuwait 
 Pyongyang, February 24 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Thursday sent a message of greetings to Sheikh Sabah Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah, emir of Kuwait, on the occasion of the 50th anniversary of its independence and the 20th anniversary of its liberation.
					 In the message the president expressed belief that the good relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would steadily grow stronger in the future, too, wishing the Kuwaiti emir and his people bigger success in the efforts for the progress and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Greetings to Kuwaiti PM and FM
articles.content:
Greetings to Kuwaiti PM and FM
Pyongyang, February 24 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Choe Yong Rim sent a message of greetings to Kuwaiti Prime Minister Sheikh Nasser Al-Muhammad Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah Thursday on the occasion of the 50th anniversary of its independence and the 20th anniversary of its liberation.
					The message wished the Prime Minister bigger success in his work for social stability and economic progress. It also wished him happiness in good health.
					
					 Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun sent a similar message to Mohamed Sabah Al Salem Al Sabah, deputy prime minister and foreign minister of Kuwait, on the same day.

articles.title: Homage to Kim Il Sung Paid
articles.content:
Homage to Kim Il Sung Paid 
						
Pyongyang, February 24 (KCNA) -- The participants of the Songun Meeting of Youth for General Mobilization visited the Kumsusan Memorial Palace and paid homage to President Kim Il Sung on Thursday.
					 They paid humble tribute to the President who originated the Korean youth movement and trained the youth as successors to the revolutionary cause of Juche, showing deep loving care for them.

articles.title: Fine Art Exhibition Draws Endless Stream of Visitors
articles.content:
Fine Art Exhibition Draws Endless Stream of Visitors 
						
Pyongyang, February 24 (KCNA) -- The national fine art exhibition for celebrating February 16, birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il, is drawing an endless stream of service personnel, people from all walks of life and school youth and children.
					 Watching Korean painting "Morning in February", acryl painting "No motherland without you", oil painting "Torchlight kindled in Kangson in December" and other works, they deeply grasp the personality of Kim Jong Il as a great man who has demonstrated the dignity and might of Kim Il Sung's nation.
					
					 Pak Kum Chol, 39, worker of the Pyongyang 326 Electric Wire Factory, said that Korean painting "Saying that President Kim Il Sung's behests have been implemented at last", oil painting "Great general has brought about a great auspicious event to the country", etc. make a truthful artistic representation of the historical fact that Kim Jong Il has carved out the future of a rich and powerful country with his energetic Songun revolutionary leadership.
					
					 Ri Hyok, 22, student at Kim Chaek University of Technology, noted that embroidery "Kimjongilia" strong in national flavor which is done with exquisite skill and Korean painting "Warm Feelings in Huichon" depict the personality of Kim Jong Il as a great man who is translating the plan of Kim Il Sung for building a rich and powerful country into a reality and the faith and will of all the service personnel and people of the DPRK to dynamically push ahead with the building of a thriving nation.
					
					 The exhibition opened with due ceremony at the Pyongyang International Cultural Centre on Feb. 11

articles.title: Multi-Functional Solar Greenhouses Built in Various Places
articles.content:
Multi-Functional Solar Greenhouses Built in Various Places
 Pyongyang, February 24 (KCNA) -- The Energy Center of the State Committee for Science and Technology in the DPRK developed a multi-functional solar greenhouse. It has been successfully introduced to various units.
					 The greenhouse is operating for stock-breeding, fish breeding, cultivating vegetables and producing methane gas simultaneously by use of solar heat.
					
					 Laid out in the greenhouse are a vegetable field, sheds for domestic animals, a fishpond and methane gas tank, etc.
					
					 The side of the greenhouse is built in semi-arch style to admit sunlight at maximum. 
					
					 The introduction of convection prevention and heat insulation methods made it possible to sharply decrease the loss in heat through the wall.
					
					 The construction of a fishpond along the side of the wall admitting sunlight in a waterway style helps increase the heat accumulating capacity, while cutting down the loss in heat from the ground by half.
					
					 In case temperature outside the greenhouse goes down as low as 20 degrees centigrade below zero, temperature inside it stands at more than 10 degrees centigrade, making it possible to cultivate vegetables even in winter.
					
					 In the greenhouse methane gas is produced by use of agricultural by-products and excrement of domestic animals and secretion from gas fermentation is used as feed for domestic animals and fishes and the leftover of the fermentation as good quality organic fertilizer.
					
					 Jong Yong Suk, 44, chairwoman of the management board of the Rihyon Co-op Farm for Vegetable Cultivation in Sadong District, Pyongyang, said, referring to the economic efficiency of the greenhouse:
					
					 The multi-functional solar greenhouse never uses fuel and is environmentally friendly. It is profitable as it has a stock-breeding and agricultural production cycle.
					
					 It is capable of boosting the vegetable production 1.5 times and livestock products 2 times, while cutting down manpower and materials.

articles.title: Theses on Socialist Rural Question Display Ever-increasing Vitality
articles.content:
Theses on Socialist Rural Question Display Ever-increasing Vitality
 Pyongyang, February 24 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung made public his immortal classical work "The Theses on the Socialist Rural Question in Our Country" on February 25, Juche 53 (1964) while working heart and soul to solve the peasants question, the rural question by attaching great importance to them from long ago. 
					 The theses have served as guidelines for successfully settling the peasants question, the rural question in socialist society, narrowing down the distinction between the urban and rural areas and that between the working class and peasantry and winning the complete victory of socialism. 
					
					 The rural areas of the DPRK have a steady advance along the road indicated by the theses, eradicating backwardness and poverty and carving out a new history of prosperity. 
					
					 His idea of building socialist rural villages has been successfully materialized under the leadership of Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 He has successfully led the work to materialize the rural theses true to the intention of the President. Kim Jong Il made sure that the political leadership of the Workers' Party of Korea and the state guidance to the rural economy were strengthened during the Arduous March, the forced march, too. 
					
					 In that period villages of bliss appeared in different parts of the country and small patches of paddy and non-paddy fields covering hundreds of thousands of hectares were realigned into standardized fields. Gravity-fed waterways were built to demonstrate the might of irrigation. 
					
					 The period also witnessed the appearance of a lot of modern stock-breeding bases including chicken, pig, duck, goat and ostrich farms and rabbit breed stock farms and large fruit production centers. 
					
					 This stirring reality clearly proves the great vitality of the theses.

articles.title: Guinean Party Leader on Relations with WPK
articles.content:
Guinean Party Leader on Relations with WPK
						
 Pyongyang, February 24 (KCNA) -- The DPRK has demonstrated its might as a power in independent in politics, self-supporting in economy and self-reliant in national defense despite the complicated international situation thanks to the tested Songun politics pursued by General Secretary Kim Jong Il, said Cisse Saloun, general secretary of the Guinean People's Assembly when meeting Ri Kyong Son, DPRK ambassador to Guinea, on Feb. 12.
					 Referring to the fact that the Workers' Party of Korea has achieved world-startling successes by leading the revolution and construction for years, he noted that it set a precious example to be followed by all parties.
					
					 The Guinean People's Assembly will make every effort to boost the friendly and cooperative relations with the WPK, he stressed.

articles.title: Japan Urged to Redress Past--Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Japan Urged to Redress Past--Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, February 24 (KCNA) -- Japan's redemption of its past is prerequisite for the normal improvement of the DPRK-Japan relations as wished by the two peoples, said Rodong Sinmun Thursday in a by-lined article.
					 The liquidation of the past is the core and starting point for improving the bilateral relations. The abnormal relations between the two countries can never be put on a normal track if Japan persistently evades the redemption of its past, the article said.
					
					 It cited facts to prove that the crimes committed by Japan in Korea during the first half of the last century were hideous crimes in history.
					
					 No statute of limitations is applicable to those hideous crimes against humanity committed by the Japanese imperialists, said the article, adding:
					
					 The international voices blaming Japan for evading the redemption of the past is increasing as the days go by.
					
					 Strong voices calling for denouncing Japan's past crimes and forcing it to make apology and reparation are heard at international conferences including the UN General Assembly and regional conferences.
					
					 Moves denouncing the authorities for evading the redemption of the past are becoming brisk in Japan, too.
					
					 Even its some politicians are calling for redressing the past.
					
					 Those countries which committed the crimes against humanity in the past have repented of their past crimes and are working hard to liquidate them on the international arena.
					
					 If Japan truly stands for improved relations with the DPRK and wants to live as a full-fledged member of the international community, trusted by the world people, it should promptly redress its past. Herein lies its future.

articles.title: US Strengthens Military Tie-up with Japan, S. Korea
articles.content:
US Strengthens Military Tie-up with Japan, S. Korea
 Pyongyang, February 24 (KCNA) -- The U.S. has tried hard to strengthen a triangular military alliance involving Japan and south Korea.
					 The U.S. has asked the Japanese "Self-Defense Forces" to participate in all military exercises it will stage with south Korea. The fact was revealed by Japanese government officials on Feb. 22.
					
					 The U.S. is reportedly sounding out the likelihood of SDF's participation in the soon-to-be-held Key Resolve joint military maneuvers with south Korea and if an arrangement is made, Japan will dispatch several SDF officers as observers as it did in last July.
					
					 The U.S. has also asked south Korea to take part in all U.S.-Japan naval exercises as observers.
					
					 Reporting the fact, the Japanese Jiji Press said the U.S. is seeking to strengthen tie-up with Japan and south Korea.

articles.title: Biofuels Cause Food Price Rise
articles.content:
Biofuels Cause Food Price Rise
 Pyongyang, February 24 (KCNA) -- The U.S. has long pursued a substitute fuel plan for producing biofuel from corn.
					 Soon after the publication of this plan, the corn price has doubled in several countries, gravely affecting those living on corn.
					
					 The world food prices showed 140 percent sharp increase in the period from 2002 to February 2008, over 75 percent of which is attributable to the massive production of biofuels by the U.S. and other Western countries, a report of the World Bank said.
					
					 The UN Food and Agriculture Organization warned that the increased biofuel production is reducing food supply, causing sharp price rise.
					
					 The January 31st issue of Cuban newspaper Granma said that in 2009 the U.S. used 119 million tons of corn for the production of ethanol, adding that 350 million people can be fed for one year with that amount.
					
					 The U.S. plan for production of biofuel from corn envisages the yearly production of 132 million liters of biofuel by 2017 for which 320 million tons of corn are needed.
					
					 People express concern that the number of people miring in abject poverty will reach 1.2 billion worldwide by 2025 unless the plan is stopped.
					
					 The U.S. biofuel plan is blamed worldwide for its criminal nature and danger.

articles.title: Japan Organizes Anti-DPRK Spy Agency
articles.content:
Japan Organizes Anti-DPRK Spy Agency
 Pyongyang, February 24 (KCNA) -- It has been revealed that Japan set up an intelligence service some time ago to gather information on the DPRK and China.
					 The Australian newspaper Sydney Morning Herald reported that the intelligence service was formed under the Cabinet Information Office, modeled on CIA and M.I.6.
					
					 Information officials of the U.S. State Department and the Japanese Cabinet reportedly discussed the organization of a spy agency in October 2008.
					
					 At the discussion the Japanese official told his U.S. counterpart that what is most urgent for Japan is to gather information on China and the DPRK, as well as information for preventing terrorism.
					
					 There existed an intelligence office in Japan called "Yamasaki" in the period of the Korean war (1950-1953). It, involving intelligence officers of the imperial army, was affiliated to the intelligence bureau of the UN Command, following the U.S. instructions. Its agents supplied the U.S. forces with detailed information about the DPRK's military facilities, harbors, factories, schools and hospitals.
					
					 The new revelation shows that Japan has persistently engaged in anti-DPRK plots.

articles.title: Normalization of North-South Relations through Dialogue Called for
articles.content:
Normalization of North-South Relations through Dialogue Called for
 Pyongyang, February 24 (KCNA) -- Ri Jong Sok, former minister of Unification of south Korea, in an invitational lecture on Feb. 21 stressed the need to seek peace on the Korean Peninsula through dialogue and balanced diplomacy such as the normalization of the south-north relations through dialogue and the resumption of the six-party talks, according to CBS of south Korea.
					 He said that the "government" should lend an ear to the voices calling for a switchover in the U.S. policy and the demand of the people, adding that it should have the courage to roll back its failed policy.

articles.title: NIS Agents' Intrusion into Indonesian Delegation's Room Denounced
articles.content:
NIS Agents' Intrusion into Indonesian Delegation's Room Denounced
Pyongyang, February 24 (KCNA) -- Agents of the "National Intelligence Service" of south Korea intruded into a hotel room for the party of the Indonesian presidential envoy to gather information on Feb. 16 only to be spotted. 
					 This case touched off bitter criticism of NIS in south Korea. 
					
					 Ri Chun Sok, a spokesman for the Democratic Party of south Korea, said that NIS is suspected of its involvement in the case, demanding a probe into the truth about the case. 
					
					 Lawmaker from the Democratic Party Kim Tong Chol charged that "the incident is the result of Lee Myung Bak work style seeking success disregarding procedures. If NIS is proven to be involved in the case, its director should be fired at once", he urged. 
					
					 The south Korean MBC said three agents of NIS secretly intruded into the hotel room to get a notebook computer only to be spotted by its owner and return it to him. They seemed to have committed a clumsy theft rather than performing a secret duty, it added. 
					
					 MBC went on:
					
					 NIS consequently seriously hurt the state interests. It is unpredictable what backlash will be followed by this incident, to say nothing of the disgrace south Korea suffered before the world. 
					
					 The Indonesian government on Feb. 21 urged the south Korean "government" to clarify the case.

articles.title: S. Korean Chief Executive Criticized for Serious Problems
articles.content:
S. Korean Chief Executive Criticized for Serious Problems
 Pyongyang, February 24 (KCNA) -- The south Korean newspaper Hangyore on Monday said the reason that the south Korean situation has become more serious is the chief executive's shirking of responsibility.
					 At a gathering with reporters at Chongwadae (presidential office) on Feb. 20 three years after he got into office, the chief executive made no comment or gave insincere answers to their questions concerning sensitive social issues, said the newspaper in an editorial.
					
					 His attitude arouses public suspicion that he tries to shirk his responsibility for tough problems, it said, adding:
					
					 The people's livelihood is getting worse because of such problems as foot-and-mouth diseases, sharp price hike and unemployment. But it is hard to find the role of the "president" and Chongwadae as state affairs coordinator.
					
					 The "president" quickly appears for live TV broadcasting only when he has something to advertise.
					
					 The press gathering clearly revealed again the reason for the serious problems.

articles.title: S. Korean "Government" Condemned for Arbitrariness
articles.content:
S. Korean "Government" Condemned for Arbitrariness
 Pyongyang, February 24 (KCNA) -- Representations of fourth south Korean opposition parties, including the Democratic Labor Party and the Democratic Party, on Feb. 22 began discussing solidarity in a parliamentary by-election to be held in April, said the south Korean Munhwa Broadcasting Corporation (MBC).
					 They adopted a joint declaration saying that the opposition parties would cooperate in judging the arbitrariness of the "government" through the election.

articles.title: S. Korean Radio Introduces Pyongyang University
articles.content:
S. Korean Radio Introduces Pyongyang University
 Pyongyang, February 24 (KCNA) -- A south Korean radio belonging to CBS introduced Pyongyang University of Science and Technology on Feb. 9.
					 Students of the university are said to work hard enjoying modern educational facilities, said the radio, adding:
					
					 A professor of the university on a vacation in an eastern area of the U.S. said on Feb. 8 that north Korean students of the university are absorbed in their studies till late at night.
					
					 According to the professor, they are fine students who studied at Kim Il Sung University, Kim Chaek University of Technology and other famous universities of north Korea. But all of them are attentive to their studies with a high degree of enthusiasm out of competitive spirit.
					
					 Their looks are generally bright but they are not different from other universities' students in competitive spirit.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Birthday Celebrated in Foreign Countries
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Birthday Celebrated in Foreign Countries 
Pyongyang, February 24 (KCNA) -- Floral baskets were sent to the DPRK missions in different countries between Feb. 12 to 16 to celebrate the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 They included the Commission for External Affairs of the Central Committee of the Communist Party, the Ministry of Defence, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, the Ministry of Public Security,  the Ministry of Industry and Commerce, the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development, the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism, the Ho Chi Minh National Academy of Politics and Public Administration, the Ho Chi Minh Communist Youth Union, the Farmers Union, the Ho Chi Minh Museum, the Diplomatic Corp Service Department, the Thang Long Corporation, the Viettel Group of Viet Nam, the Vietnam-DPRK Friendship Association, the Vietnam-DPRK Friendship Club and the Vietnam-DPRK Friendship Kindergarten, the Organization Commission of the Central Committee of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party and the Ministry of Information and Culture of Laos, the Ministry of Defence and Armed Forces Logistics of Iran, the Staff of the General Command of Armed Forces of Iran, the Iranian Workers' House, the International Taekwon-Do Association in Iran and the Judo Federation of Iran, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, the Council for the Promotion of International Commerce and the Chamber of Commerce and Industry of Myanmar, the Myanmar Asia World Co. Ltd. and embassies of different countries in Myanmar, the Central Committee of the Communist Party of India (Marxist), the United Malays National Organization of Malaysia, the Malaysian Chinese Association (MCA), the Malaysian People's Movement, the Yang Tzi Cruise & Tour SDN. BHD. the Dickson Wong SDN.BHD., the M.K.P. Company, the Johnson Nicholson Company, the Guinean People's Assembly, the Chinese embassy in Berne, the Government of Geneva Canton of Switzerland, the People's Front of Workers, Peasants and Students of Peru, the Peruvian preparatory committee for commemorating the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung, the American regional preparatory committee for commemorating the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung, the Syrian vice-presidents, the deputy secretary and the director of the Organizational Department of the Regional Leadership of the Syria's Baath Arab Socialist Party, the Minister of Defence of Syria, the chief of the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Syria, the president of the Syrian Trade Unions Federation and the chairman of the General Union of Syrian Peasants, the vice-prime minister and minister of Defence, the minister of Health, the mayor of Vientiane City and the secretary general of the Ministry of Public Security of Laos and the secretary of the  General People's Committee of the Great Socialist People's Libyan Arab Jamahiriya.

articles.title: Korean Book, Photo and Handicraft Exhibitions Open Abroad
articles.content:
Korean Book, Photo and Handicraft Exhibitions Open Abroad
Pyongyang, February 24 (KCNA) -- Korean book, photo and handicraft exhibitions opened at various institutions in Russia, Vietnam and Mexico between Feb. 11 and 16 to celebrate the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 They were the Far Eastern Art Museum in Khabarovsk, a museum and a company in Nakhodka and Moscow, Russia, Ho Chi Minh Museum in Vietnam and a cultural hall in Mexico.
					
					 Displayed at the exhibitions were works of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, photos on their immortal exploits and books, photos and handicrafts showing the true picture of Songun Korea.
					
					 Speeches were made at the opening ceremonies.
					
					 The vice-minister of Culture of the Government of the Khabarovsk Territory said that the exhibition opening to celebrate the birthday of Kim Jong Il is making a great contribution to further boosting the relations of cultural cooperation between the peoples of Russia and the DPRK.
					
					 The curator of Ho Chi Minh Museum noted that Vietnam and the DPRK have long-standing friendly relations provided and developed by President Ho Chi Minh and President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 He expressed belief that the exhibition would provide an important opportunity for developing the traditional friendly and cooperative relations between the two parties, governments and peoples onto a new phase.
					
					 The chief of a district office of the city of Mexico hoped that the Korean people would register greater success in their efforts to achieve the prosperity of the country, social progress and accomplish the socialist cause under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il in the future, too.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Posted on Polish Internet Website
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Posted on Polish Internet Website
Pyongyang, February 24 (KCNA) -- The Poland-DPRK Association posted on its Internet website the full text of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "The Songun-based Revolutionary Line Is a Great Revolutionary Line of Our Era and an Ever-Victorious Banner of Our Revolution" on Feb. 16.
					 The work, made public on Jan. 29, 2003, clarifies the idea that the Workers' Party of Korea's Songun revolutionary line, the Songun politics is a powerful political mode of the present era which inherited and developed President Kim Il Sung's idea and line of attaching importance to arms and a scientific revolutionary line, a political mode which most correctly reflected the requirements of the times and the revolution. 
					
					 It also clarifies the validity, advantages and great vitality of the Songun politics.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Birthday Celebrated in Various Countries
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Birthday Celebrated in Various Countries
Pyongyang, February 24 (KCNA) -- Meetings took place in Denmark, South Africa and France on Feb. 14 and 15 to celebrate the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 Anders Kristensen, chairman of the Denmark-DPRK Friendship Association, said in his speech that Kim Jong Il has further developed in depth the immortal Juche idea founded by President Kim Il Sung and turned the DPRK into a politico-ideological and military power under the uplifted banner of Songun.
					
					 David Mahobo, chairperson of the Mahlambandlophy, Pretoria City, Branch of the African National Congress of South Africa, referred to the fact that Kim Jong Il has made tireless efforts to build a socialist power in Korea by pursuing the unique Songun politics.  
					
					 Andre Aubry, delegate president of the France-Korea Friendship Association, praised Kim Jong Il as a great man for having performed immortal exploits by wisely leading the Korean people's struggle to build socialism and reunify the country.
					
					 Kim Jong Il represents a banner of victory and glory for the world anti-imperialist, independent forces, he added.
					
					 A congratulatory message to Kim Jong Il was adopted at a meeting in Denmark.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Birthday Observed in Italy
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Birthday Observed in Italy 
Pyongyang, February 24 (KCNA) -- Osvaldo Pesce, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Unified Communist Party of Italy, made public a statement on February 14 on the occasion of the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il. 
					 In his statement he noted that Kim Jong Il has made a distinguishing contribution to the struggle to defend the sovereignty of the country and the nation. Thanks to his Songun leadership the Korean people have demonstrated the dignity and honor as a people of an independent power and military power, he said, and went on:
					
					 The conference of the Workers' Party of Korea last year reelected Kim Jong Il as its general secretary and elected Kim Jong Un as vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the WPK, demonstrating once again the trust of all the people in their leader. 
					
					 The Korean people led by the great leader will surely build a socialist thriving nation and achieve the reunification of the country.

articles.title: New York Times Write-up on Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
New York Times Write-up on Kim Il Sung
 Pyongyang, February 24 (KCNA) -- On October 27, 1969, New York Times carried a write-up praising President Kim Il Sung.
					  Under the headline "Korea Produces Hero of 20th Century" the newspaper dedicated a whole page to a gist of "Kim Il Sung Biography" (vol. 1).
					
					 It was of great significance that a famous newspaper of the U.S. hostile to the DPRK carried a write-up describing Kim Il Sung as a hero of the 20th century.
					
					 Following the newspaper, London Times and major Japanese media reported the gist.
					
					 The Singaporean newspaper Nanyang Siang Pau and Sudanese newspaper
					
					 The Sudan News also highlighted it.

articles.title: Cuba, Belarus Join Hands in Opposing US Sanctions
articles.content:
Cuba, Belarus Join Hands in Opposing US Sanctions
 Pyongyang, February 24 (KCNA) -- Cuba and Belarus on Feb. 22 expressed their willingness to continue supporting each other against U.S. sanctions.
					 Speaking at a press conference in Minsk, Cuban Foreign Minister Bruno Rodriguez Parrilla said Cuba opposes U.S. and EU sanctions against Belarus, considering them an infringement on the country's sovereignty.
					
					 To develop relations with Belarus is given priority in Cuba's foreign policy, said the Cuban official.
					
					 Belarus Foreign Minister Sergei Martinov told the press conference that the two countries are closely akin to each other in the position concerning the development of the Non-Aligned Movement and other international matters. 
					
					 Belarus has always supported Cuba in rejecting U.S. sanctions and will as ever do the same, he declared.

articles.title: Russia Criticizes US over Kurils
articles.content:
Russia Criticizes US over Kurils
 Moscow, February 24 (KCNA) -- Recently, Russia summoned the U.S. ambassador to express its dissatisfaction at the U.S. rhetoric apparently supporting Japan in the 65-odd-year-long dispute between Russia and Japan over four islands in the Pacific.
					 Russia took issue with remarks made recently by authorities of the U.S. Department of State and the U.S. embassy in Moscow supporting Japan in the dispute.
					
					 The four islands, called Kurils in Russia and northern territories in Japan, have remained under the jurisdiction of Russia since they were occupied by the Russian army at the end of the Second World War.

articles.title: Civil Rights Violation Serious in Russia
articles.content:
Civil Rights Violation Serious in Russia
 Moscow, February 24 (KCNA) -- The Supreme Prosecutor's Office of the Russian Federation laid bare over 2.5 million cases of infringement on civil rights and freedom outside criminal law last year.
					 The prosecutor general said this when he met with the UN high commissioner for Human Rights on Feb. 14.

articles.title: Russian Official Predicts Food Price Hike
articles.content:
Russian Official Predicts Food Price Hike
 Moscow, February 24 (KCNA) -- The Russian Finance Minister in a TV interview on Feb. 18 said that food price is likely to rise steadily worldwide this year.
					 This year's food price will be a record high, the minister said. Issues of holding the price hike in check will be discussed at the Krasnoyarsk Economic Forum. 
					
					 In January the potato price jumped more than 30 percent in eighteen federal subjects of Russia, while the beef price went up 4.4 percent on an average and the liquor and bread prices 2.6 percent throughout the country.

articles.title: Sankt-Peterburg Attacked by Influenza
articles.content:
Sankt-Peterburg Attacked by Influenza
Moscow, February 24 (KCNA) -- The morbidity rate of influenza in Sankt-Peterburg, Russia, has risen 48.5 percent in a week.
					3,200 to 13,500 cases were reportedly recorded every day except Saturday and Sunday, 9,000 cases on a weekly average.
					
					Six schools were closed with thirty percent of students absent, and 408 classes of 138 schools suspended lessons.

articles.title: China Encourages Servicepersons to Study Hard
articles.content:
China Encourages Servicepersons to Study Hard
 Beijing, February 24 (KCNA) -- China has called on all people and army to study hard.
					 In particular, the country has paid deep concern to stimulating service personnel to improve their political and military knowledge so that they can contribute to promoting socialism with Chinese characteristics.
					
					 Recently, the General Political Department of the Chinese People's Liberation Army released "Study Regulations for Military Cadres Affiliated to the Party".
					
					 The regulations demand all Party organizations implement President Hu Jintao's important instructions for intensifying study to build able and effective military guiding bodies. They also clarify the importance, contents and methods of study and its guidance.
					
					 The General Political Department called for the whole army and police to observe the regulations.

articles.title: Anecdote about Kim Jong Suk
articles.content:
Anecdote about Kim Jong Suk
 Pyongyang, February 24 (KCNA) -- It happened one day in January of 1936 when the anti-Japanese armed struggle was under way.
					 The command of the Korean People's Revolutionary Army organized a battle to wipe out troops of the Manchukuo army who committed all sorts of atrocities against people near a village in Liushucun at that time. 
					
					 Anti-Japanese War Hero Kim Jong Suk participated in the battle as a member of a raid party.
					
					 The party's mission was to quickly storm into the enemy barracks but they were enclosed with a high castle wall.
					
					 The commanding officer and soldiers of the party were at a loss what to do.
					
					 At that time Kim Jong Suk looked at the wall carefully and found that it was built with earth. She told the commanding officer that digging the lowest part of the wall a bit and pushing it might bring it to collapse.
					
					 The commanding officer and soldiers were stunned by her judgment.
					
					 By an order of the commanding officer, the members of the party scooped out in a moment the lowest part of the wall and pushed it with all their might till it collapsed.
					
					 The party dynamically dashed ahead, wiping out the enemy.
					
					 Thanks to the rare wisdom of Kim Jong Suk, the Liushucun battle ended in the victory of the KPRA.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam envia mensaje de felicitacion al emir de Kuwait
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam envia mensaje de felicitacion al emir de Kuwait
Pyongyang, 24 de febrero (ATCC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 24 un mensaje al emir del Estado de Kuwait, Sheikh Sabah Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah, para felicitarle por el 50o aniversario de la independencia y el 20o de la liberacion de ese pais. 
					El remitente expresa la conviccion de que las excelentes relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los dos paises seguiran ampliandose y desarrollandose tambien en el futuro y desea al mandatario y al pueblo de Kuwait mayores exitos en sus esfuerzos por el progreso y la prosperidad del pais.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun demanda a Japon liquidacion del pasado criminal
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun demanda a Japon liquidacion del pasado criminal
						
Pyongyang, 24 de febrero (ATCC) -- Para mejorar las anormales relaciones entre Corea y Japon de acuerdo con la aspiracion y la demanda de los pueblos de los dos paises, es inminente solucionar el problema de liquidacion del pasado criminal del pais isleno. 
					Senala el diario Rodong Sinmun en un articulo individual difundido en su edicion de este jueves y prosigue:
					
					La liquidacion del pasado es el nucleo y punto de partida para la mejora de las relaciones entre ambos paises.
					
					En la primera mitad del siglo pasado Japon cometio en Corea archi-crimenes de lesa humanidad, nunca vistos en la historia, que no tienen el periodo de prescripcion. 
					
					Se hace cada dia mas fuerte la presion internacional sobre Japon que evade de todos modos la liquidacion de tal pasado.
					
					La Asamblea General de la ONU y otros foros internacionales y regionales revelan y denuncian los crimenes del pasado de Japon y alzan las voces en demanda de cobrar disculpas e indemnizacion por el respecto.
					
					En la sociedad japonesa se activan los movimientos para ejercer presion a las autoridades que evaden tal liquidacion.
					
					Lo exige tambien el circulo politico de Japon.
					
					En la actual palestra internacional los paises que habian cometido crimenes antieticos se reflexionan de estos y se esfuerzan por liquidarlos completamente. 
					
					Si Japon desea de veras la mejora de las relaciones con Corea y la confianza del mundo y quiere vivir dignamente como un pais miembro de la sociedad internacional, debe liquidar lo mas pronto posible su pasado criminal. He aqui el porvenir del pais isleno.

articles.title: Exposiciones coreanas por el 16 de febrero en varios paises
articles.content:
Exposiciones coreanas por el 16 de febrero en varios paises
						
Pyongyang, 24 de febrero (ATCC) -- Con motivo del dia de nacimiento del Dirigente Kim Jong Il, tuvieron lugar del dia 11 al 16 las exposiciones coreanas de libros, fotos, bordados y productos de artes menores en el Museo de Bellas Artes del Lejano Oriente de la Ciudad de Jabarovsk, el museo de la ciudad de Najodka, la compania anonima de Moscu y el Museo Ho Chi Minh de Vietnam.
					Estaban expuestos en los lugares de actos las obras del Presidente Kim Il Sung y el Dirigente, las fotos alusivas a sus imborrables hazanas, los libros, fotos, bordados y artesanales que dan a conocer aspectos de Corea del Songun.
					
					En las ocasiones hubo discursos.
					
					El viceministro de Cultura del Gobierno del Territorio de Jabarovsk, Rusia destaco que la presente exhibicion, que tiene lugar con motivo del cumpleanos del Dirigente, contribuye grandemente a desarrollar las relaciones de cultura y cooperacion entre los pueblos de los dos paises.
					
					El director del Museo Ho Chi Minh preciso que Vietnam y Corea cuentan con las largas relaciones de amistad preparadas por los presidentes Ho Chi Minh y Kim Il Sung y manifesto su conviccion de que la exposicion hara aporte importante a lleva a nuevo alto las tradiciones relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los partidos, gobiernos y pueblos de ambos paises.

articles.title: Relaciones antagonicas Rusia-EE.UU. en torno al sistema antimissiles
articles.content:
Relaciones antagonicas Rusia-EE.UU. en torno al sistema antimisiles
Pyongyang, 24 de febrero (ATCC) -- Recientemente, el canciller ruso y su homologa norteamericana intercambiaron el documento de ratificacion del nuevo START que entro asi en vigor oficialmente.
					Sin embargo, pretextando que el prologo del START no tiene validez legal, EE.UU. dice que el tratado no obstaculiza el establecimiento de su sistema antimisiles en Europa y que es necesario conversar con Rusia en cuanto al problema de renovar el arsenal nuclear y restringir las armas nucleares tacticas.
					
					Rusia advirtio a EE.UU. que se retiraria del nuevo START si este sigue impulsando el establecimiento del sistema antimisiles en Europa, mantendria su potencialidad nuclear y disposicion de combate, desarrollaria de continuo los sofisticados armamentos estrategicos capaces de hacer frente a la red de defensa antimisil norteamericana.
					
					Estados Unidos no deja de establecerla por su parte e intenta expandirla mas.
					
					El mandatario norteamericano senalo que eso no dara a Rusia el pretexto de la retirada del nuevo START.
					
					A traves de ese sistema, EE.UU. intenta tomar la superioridad militar y la posicion hegemonica en Europa y Rusia lo considera como amenaza.
					
					Partiendo de los contradictorios intereses estrategicos, los dos paises continuan la disputa en ese tema.
					
					Rusia, que desarrolla el ICBM de nueva generacion, sentencio a Estados Unidos que desplegaria nuevas armas estrategicas de ataque si ambos no llegan a un acuerdo en el tema de defensa antimisil.

articles.title: Politico guineo aboga por desarrollar relaciones de amistad con PTC
articles.content:
Politico guineo aboga por desarrollar relaciones de amistad con PTC
Pyongyang, 24 de febrero (ATCC) -- El secretario general de la Reunion Popular de Guinea, Cisse Saloun, se reunio con el embajador coreano acreditado en su pais, Ri Kyong Son.
					  El dijo que gracias a la probada politica de Songun de Su Excelencia Kim Jong Il, Corea manifiesta su aspecto majestuoso de potencia de independencia, de autososten y de autodefensa aun en medio de la situacion internacional tan complicada.
					
					  Prosiguio que el Partido del Trabajo de Corea logro los grandes exitos que asombran al mundo dirigiendo la revolucion y la construccion de largo tiempo y creo el modelo precioso que todos los partidos politicos deben aprender.
					
					  Subrayo que la Reunion Popular de Guinea hara ingentes esfuerzos por ampliar y desarrollar las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion con el PTC.
